comment: Watch your grammar and don't wait until last minute to post discussions and you will have no problems with this professor. Should you need it, she gives opportunities for extra credit throughout the semester. A lot of writing, but overall an easy and straight-forward course.

Takes off points for no reason or small errors. Majority of class is keep busy work. It seems like she couldn't care less about the class. Mainly 1 or 2 page papers for assignments. Gave us a study guide for a test and the material was based on stuff from other chapters of the book, not what we were going over. Avoid this teacher if you can.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This Professor is clear with objectives and give excellent feedback on assignments. She has a good grading turnaround and offers extra credit. We had a large group project due during the semester. She gives you a lot of time to prepare, as well as making assignments, discussions, and tests very clear. She offered a study guide for the mid term.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Another class try a little bit and you should get an A, group project throughout the course very little information came out of our teacher but I just did my stuff and turned it in, midterm was easy final was easy no lockdown, discussions were at least interesting to do and write

Professor was rude sometimes in her responses to emails and when it came to grading she would always try to find something to take off for. Class consists of 12 assignments, a group project with 4 parts, discussions, and midterm and final. Her instructions are so unclear that you will find yourself having to email her all the time. dont reccomend

Taking E-commerce summer 2020. The most responsive, respectful, helpful, encouraging professor I have had in my online career at university. Gives great feedback on assignments and gives opportunities to improve the project grade. If you want a real professor that actually cares about your education, this is her. You wont regret taking her class!

I'm taking online Electronic Commerce Summer 2020. Unlike my other online professors, she never gives any feedback on the assignments to prove for the next one and gives a bad grade. She is the worst one in KSU.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She explained everything in detail. Very structured. Had 4 group assignments. We did not have and quizzes and 2 exams. She also kept her students in the loop about job leads that she knew of.

One term project with a group where you create an e-commerce website for selling products. The individual labs are very well laid out however the group projects rubric change between documents and the concept of what you need to do is very unclear. Tests make absolutely no sense in how they are structured and don't usually pertain to the curriculum
Great professor! Would recommend anyone to take her. Her teaching style makes it easy to learn and completely understand the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Took the online section of Advanced Database. This has got to be the most frustrating class I've ever taken. Labs require "5-6" hours but in reality, everything you "learn" comes from links to the oracle site, so it takes 10-12 hours to teach yourself what the heck is going on. This seemed to only be easier for her, since she didn't have to teach.

There are a lot of home works for this class, and they are usually long. A lot of research material is required, but overall learning experience was great. There are no quizzes or exams for this class, but the Term project and group project will make up for the lack of it. My advice, start working on the project items as early as you can !!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy going professor. The class was easy for me in general. There were a homework that was due every week and a few quizzes that are due time to time. There is a lot of reading required, but it is easy material to understand. The exams are long, and essay based questions. Overall, if you show you know the concepts, you will have a good time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great teacher. You can tell she worked in the field and is constantly giving us tips/stories on real world examples. Her assignments were unclear at times but if you talk to her in class about them she's pretty reasonable when it comes to the grading criteria. What a college professor should aspire to be.
The class helped me understand the role, and importance IT plays in the success of  a company
I took Ms. Rabah for my  E-commerce  class. She was great at breaking down the information and providing lots of examples to support the material.

I took the Advanced DB course with professor Rabah, which utilized Oracle 12c. She was well organized, well prepared, and knew the subject very well. We covered PL/SQL Procedures and Triggers, querying the Data Dictionary, managing users, and much more. I learned a lot from this class and would highly recommend.

Took online section of software design and development. Unlike my other online professors, she never posted any lectures or anything online. The quizzes were not hard and the assignments weren't too hard but I felt a little left in the dark since the book was so poorly written and all over the place (how to program - deitel 10th edition)

Took her this semester for many classes. She can seem like a moody grader, but sometimes it can work to your advantage. If a whole class has a problem with a test or an assignment, she will grant leniency. Her assignments can be busy work and also very confusing. She wants class participation. Open to student input, if it makes sense.
